com.eatthepath.jeospatial
Interface GeospatialPoint

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleGeospatialPoint
public interface GeospatialPoint

A geospatial point is a single point on the earth's surface.

Author:
Jon Chambers

Field Summary
static double EARTH_RADIUS
          The radius of the earth in meters; all implementing whose distance calculations rely upon the radius of the earth should reference this value.

Field Detail

EARTH_RADIUS

static final double EARTH_RADIUS

The radius of the earth in meters; all implementing whose distance calculations rely upon the radius of the earth should reference this value.

The earth, for the purposes of this library, is considered to be a sphere with a radius of 6371000.0 meters.

See Also:
getDistanceTo(GeospatialPoint), Constant Field Values
Method Detail

setLatitude

void setLatitude(double latitude)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
Sets the latitude of this point. Note that, for points in a GeospatialPointDatabase, this method should not be called directly. The database's movePoint method should be used instead. Latitudes must be in the range -90 to +90 degrees (inclusive on both ends); latitudes outside that range will be rejected with an IllegalArgumentException.

Parameters:
latitude - the latitude of this point in degrees
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the given latitude is outside of the range -90 to +90 (inclusive on both ends)
See Also:
GeospatialPointDatabase.movePoint(GeospatialPoint, GeospatialPoint), GeospatialPointDatabase.movePoint(GeospatialPoint, double, double)

setLongitude

void setLongitude(double longitude)
Sets the longitude of this point. Note that, for points in a GeospatialPointDatabase, this method should not be called directly. The database's movePoint method should be used instead.

Parameters:
longitude - the longitude of this point in degrees
See Also:
GeospatialPointDatabase.movePoint(GeospatialPoint, GeospatialPoint), GeospatialPointDatabase.movePoint(GeospatialPoint, double, double)

getLatitude

double getLatitude()
Returns the latitude of this point.

Returns:
the latitude of this point in degrees

getLongitude

double getLongitude()
Returns the longitude of this point. The returned longitude should be normalized to the range -180 degrees (inclusive) to 180 degrees (exclusive).

Returns:
the longitude of this point in degrees

getDistanceTo

double getDistanceTo(GeospatialPoint otherPoint)

Calculates the "great circle" or orthometric distance between this point and another point on the earth's surface. The great circle distance is the minimum distance traveled to get from one point to the next on the surface of the earth.

Implementations of this method that incorporate the radius of the earth should reference the EARTH_RADIUS property of this interface.

Parameters:
otherPoint - the other point to which to calculate distance
Returns:
the great circle distance between the two points in meters
See Also:
EARTH_RADIUS

getDistanceTo

double getDistanceTo(double latitude,
                     double longitude)

Calculates the "great circle" or orthometric distance between this point and another point on the earth's surface. The great circle distance is the minimum distance traveled to get from one point to the next on the surface of the earth.

Implementations of this method that incorporate the radius of the earth should reference the EARTH_RADIUS property of this interface.

Parameters:
latitude - the latitude, in degrees, of the other point to which to calculate distance
longitude - the longitude, in degrees, of the other point to which to calculate distance
Returns:
the great circle distance between the two points in meters
See Also:
EARTH_RADIUS
